messages: b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:59): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: how does one determine if <datagrid> is being used as a tree widget or whether it is being used as a grid widget?
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (23:09): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, <t?> makes the script throw an internal error
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (23:09): and by script i mean html5lib of course
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:10): wfm
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:10): using the latest SVN version?
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (23:11): no, i'm using b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c.net atm
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:11): that might not be up to date
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (23:12): yeah, i guess that's the case then
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:13): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: i don't understand the question (datagrid)

b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:15): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: platform widget sets have tree widgets (disclosure triangles or equivalent on the left) and grid widgets (typically no disclosure triagles, column headings available)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:15): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: how should a UA decide which widget to use?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:15): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: should the UA report the datagrid to AT as a tree or as a grid?
b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c (23:16): 425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72: I upgraded html5lib just minutes ago

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:16): 425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72, if you checkout the CVS version you can cd into the python directorary and run something like 'python parse.py "<t?>"' and get something out of it
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:16): is creating a table that shows mappings between WAI roles and HTML5 features
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:16): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: the <datagrid> element is both, you can have it in a mode with headers amd discolsure triangles
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:16): b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c, why does http:/ b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c.net/html5/parsetree/parsetree?source=%3Ct%3E throw an error though?
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (23:16): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, that's good to know, not an expert at Python yet, thanks!
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:16): b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c, does it have strict handling?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:17): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: so do you report it to AT as a tree or as a grid?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:17): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: is there a way to tell?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:17): b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c, everything throws errors, it seems like something is no longer correct
b406b22e31ce6e541c3754a7214cec1c (23:17): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: yea, I look into it
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:18): wonders if there were any architecture changes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:18): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: report it as a tree, i guess, though it might all be at the same level
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:19): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: I expect this spec detail will get comments down the road
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:19): <datagrid> is quite hard to get through as currently specced :(

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:21): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: as far as i can tell, the <datagrid> widget maps directly to the widget in iTunes and to similar widgets in pretty much every modern mail client
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:21): hell even _pine_ uses this kind of widget
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:23): hmm. I see disclosure triangles in iTunes only in the Podcast view
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:23): and in that view they aren't the leftmost column...
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:24): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: how does JAWS read that widget to you?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:24): turns on VoiceOver
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:26): when VoiceOver reads a cell that is on a row that has an open disclosure triagle, it says "expanded"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (23:27): it seems that VoiceOver groks the concept of cell and the expanded status of rows at the same time
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:27): dunno, haven't tried using JAWS there yet
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:27): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, are you creating a new code.google.com/ page this week or doing different surveys?

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:35): in addition you got a lengthy e-mail back :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:36): oh good
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:36): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, I'd be very interested how often the adoption agency algorithm is hit
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:36): haven't got to that yet

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:37): As in, how many times is an element duplicated in the average case
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:37): my parser skips straight past the entity parsing and the input stream tweaking (e.g. getting rid of U+0000)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:37): hm, might be able to do that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:38): mail the list?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:38): or me

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:38): And maybe investigate if we can adopt the Safari algorithm that produces significantly less elements

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (23:39): wonders why sebastian doesn't mind XHTML 1.5 as much as XHTML5
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:39): I guess because it gives the impression that XHTML2 is the future
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (23:39): (and always will be)
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (23:40): 1.5 doesn't have the useful property of being able to say (x)html5
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (23:41): will stay away from naming debates
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:42): for <p><b><p>...<p>...<p>... the spec does <p><b></b><p><b>....</b><p> and Safari does <p><b>..</b><p><b><p>...</p> ...</b> aiui
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (23:43): dhyatt said that it's less expensive than the current algorithm but they encountered one issue with it so far
